response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age and Gender", "medium", "A young adult male tends to have a higher risk of recidivism due to age-related impulsivity and peer influences."],
    ["Race", "medium", "While race itself is not a direct causal factor, systemic issues may affect opportunities and supervision which can indirectly influence risk."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Having been arrested twice and convicted is a strong indicator for higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Physical Attributes", "low", "Height and weight have negligible influence on recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital and Living Status", "medium", "Never having been married and living alone may suggest less social support, which can contribute to increased risk."],
    ["Education", "medium", "A high school diploma without further college enrollment suggests limited opportunities for personal development, which may modestly increase risk."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Holding only 2 jobs within a year indicates employment instability, which can be a risk factor."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use can contribute to risk, though it is moderate compared to harder substances."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Feelings of persistent sadness may reflect underlying issues that can contribute to recidivism if not addressed."],
    ["Family and Upbringing", "medium", "Growing up in an urban, small household may involve exposure to environmental risk factors, though it is not definitive by itself."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Attributing life events to a higher power can be a protective factor if it promotes positive coping mechanisms."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: A young adult male tends to have a higher risk of recidivism due to age-related impulsivity and peer influences.
While race itself is not a direct causal factor, systemic issues may affect opportunities and supervision which can indirectly influence risk.
Having been arrested twice and convicted is a strong indicator for higher recidivism risk.
Height and weight have negligible influence on recidivism risk.
Never having been married and living alone may suggest less social support, which can contribute to increased risk.
A high school diploma without further college enrollment suggests limited opportunities for personal development, which may modestly increase risk.
Holding only 2 jobs within a year indicates employment instability, which can be a risk factor.
Recent marijuana use can contribute to risk, though it is moderate compared to harder substances.
Feelings of persistent sadness may reflect underlying issues that can contribute to recidivism if not addressed.
Growing up in an urban, small household may involve exposure to environmental risk factors, though it is not definitive by itself.
Attributing life events to a higher power can be a protective factor if it promotes positive coping mechanisms.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
